canonical_explanation.text: India is a democratic country, which means people choose their leaders by voting. Adults who are 18 years or older can vote in elections. The government makes rules and laws to keep people safe and to make sure things run smoothly. There are different levels of government. In villages, the local government is called the Panchayat, headed by a Sarpanch. In towns and cities, the local government is called the Municipality or Municipal Corporation, headed by a Mayor. The local government takes care of roads, water supply, garbage collection, streetlights, and parks. Public services are services provided for the benefit of all people. The Police keep us safe, catch criminals, and maintain law and order. We call 100 (or 112) in an emergency for police help. The Fire Brigade puts out fires and rescues people from fire and other emergencies. We call 101 for fire emergencies. Hospitals and doctors take care of our health. We call 108 for an ambulance. Schools provide education, and the post office delivers letters and parcels. The government needs money to provide these services. This money comes from taxes. Taxes are money that people pay to the government from their earnings. The government uses tax money to build roads, schools, hospitals, and to pay for public services.
rules: India is a democracy where people choose leaders by voting
Adults aged 18 and above can vote
Panchayat is the local government in villages, headed by a Sarpanch
Municipality is the local government in cities, headed by a Mayor
Local government manages roads, water, garbage, streetlights, parks
Police (100/112) keep us safe and maintain law and order
Fire Brigade (101) puts out fires and rescues people
Ambulance (108) takes sick or injured people to hospital
Taxes are money people pay to the government
Tax money is used to build roads, schools, hospitals, and run public services

questions.question_text: What is the local government in a village called?
questions.explanation_correct: The local government in a village is called the Panchayat. The word 'Panchayat' comes from 'panch' meaning five, as it was originally a council of five members. It is headed by a Sarpanch.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Municipality is for cities, not villages. Parliament is the national government. The Supreme Court is for law and justice. The Panchayat is the correct term for village local government.

questions.question_text: Who is the head of a Panchayat?
questions.explanation_correct: The head of a Panchayat is called the Sarpanch. The Sarpanch is elected by the people of the village and works to solve the problems of the villagers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A Mayor heads a municipality (city). The Prime Minister heads the central government. A Governor heads a state. The Sarpanch is the head of the village Panchayat.

questions.question_text: What is the local government in a city called?
questions.explanation_correct: The local government in a city or town is called a Municipality or Municipal Corporation. It is responsible for managing city services like roads, water supply, and garbage collection.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Panchayat is for villages, not cities. Village council is also for villages. District court is a court of law. Municipality or Municipal Corporation is the local government for cities.

questions.question_text: Who is the head of a Municipality?
questions.explanation_correct: The head of a Municipality or Municipal Corporation is called the Mayor. The Mayor works with other members to manage city services and solve the problems of the city's residents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Sarpanch heads a Panchayat (village). The Chief Minister heads a state government. The Collector is a district officer. The Mayor is the head of a Municipality.

questions.question_text: True or False: The Panchayat takes care of village roads, water supply, and cleanliness.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. The Panchayat is responsible for managing village roads, water supply, sanitation, and cleanliness. It also takes care of streetlights, schools, and health centres in the village.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is correct. The Panchayat does manage village roads, water supply, and cleanliness, along with other local services.

questions.question_text: The roads in Ravi's village are broken and need repair. Who should the villagers complain to?
questions.explanation_correct: Village roads are managed by the Panchayat, so the villagers should complain to the Sarpanch and the Panchayat members. The Panchayat is responsible for maintaining village roads, water, and other local services.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Prime Minister handles national matters. The school principal manages the school. The police handle law and order. Village road repair is the responsibility of the Sarpanch and Panchayat.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a public service?
questions.explanation_correct: Police protection is a public service. Public services are services provided by the government for the benefit of all people. Other public services include fire brigade, hospitals, schools, and post office.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A birthday party, video game, and dinner at home are private activities. Police protection is a public service because it is provided by the government for everyone's safety.

questions.question_text: What does the police do?

options.text: Keep us safe and maintain law and order

questions.explanation_correct: The police keep us safe, catch criminals, maintain law and order, help in accidents, and control traffic. They protect the people and make sure everyone follows the law.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Putting out fires is the job of the Fire Brigade. Delivering letters is done by the post office. Teaching is done by teachers. The police specifically keep us safe and maintain law and order.

questions.question_text: What is the emergency number for calling the police in India?
questions.explanation_correct: The police emergency number in India is 100. You can also call 112, which is the universal emergency number that connects to police, fire, or ambulance services.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 101 is for the fire brigade. 108 is for ambulance. 104 is for health helpline. The police emergency number is 100, and 112 is the universal emergency number.

questions.question_text: What does the Fire Brigade do?

options.text: Puts out fires and rescues people from fire

questions.explanation_correct: The Fire Brigade puts out fires and rescues people trapped in fires and other emergencies. Firefighters are very brave and risk their lives to save others.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Catching thieves is the job of the police. Delivering parcels is done by the post office. Growing crops is done by farmers. The Fire Brigade fights fires and rescues people.

questions.question_text: What number should you call for a fire emergency?
questions.explanation_correct: The fire emergency number in India is 101. You should call this number if you see a fire. You can also call 112, which is the universal emergency number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 100 is for police. 108 is for ambulance. 104 is for health helpline. 101 is the correct number for fire emergencies in India.

questions.question_text: If someone is very sick and needs to go to the hospital urgently, which number should you call?
questions.explanation_correct: You should call 108 for an ambulance. The ambulance will rush the sick or injured person to the hospital. Ambulances have sirens and can move through traffic quickly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 100 is for police. 101 is for fire. 181 is for women's helpline. 108 is the number for calling an ambulance when someone needs urgent medical help.

questions.question_text: True or False: 112 is a single emergency number in India that can connect you to police, fire, or ambulance.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. 112 is the universal emergency number in India. When you call 112, the operator can connect you to police (100), fire (101), or ambulance (108) based on your emergency.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is correct. 112 is India's universal emergency number that works for all types of emergencies and can connect you to the right service.

questions.question_text: Neha sees smoke coming from a building in her neighbourhood. What should she do first?

options.text: Go inside the building to check
Tell an adult and call 101 (fire) or 112 (emergency)
Try to put out the fire herself

questions.explanation_correct: Neha should immediately tell an adult and call 101 (fire) or 112 (emergency). She should NOT go inside a burning building or try to fight the fire herself, as that is dangerous. The Fire Brigade is trained to handle fires.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Going inside a burning building is very dangerous. Ignoring it could put lives at risk. A child should never try to put out a fire. The right action is to tell an adult and call the fire emergency number.

questions.question_text: What are taxes?

options.text: Money people get from the government
Money people pay to the government
Money people save in a bank

questions.explanation_correct: Taxes are money that people pay to the government. The government uses this money to build roads, schools, hospitals, and to provide public services like police, fire brigade, and water supply.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taxes are not money received from the government, saved in banks, or spent on toys. Taxes are money paid by people to the government so that the government can provide services for everyone.

questions.question_text: The government uses tax money to:
questions.explanation_correct: The government uses tax money to build and maintain roads, schools, hospitals, bridges, parks, and to pay for public services like police, fire brigade, and water supply.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tax money is not used for toys, birthday gifts, or cars for everyone. It is used for public goods like roads, schools, hospitals, and services that benefit all citizens.

questions.question_text: True or False: The government road near your house was probably built using tax money.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Government roads are built and maintained using tax money collected from the people. This is one of the main ways taxes are used — to build infrastructure that everyone can use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is correct. Public roads built by the government are funded by tax money. This is why paying taxes is important — it helps build things that benefit everyone.

questions.question_text: Arjun's father says, 'I pay taxes so that our city can have better schools and hospitals.' Is he right?

options.text: No, taxes have nothing to do with schools and hospitals
Yes, tax money is used to build and run government schools and hospitals
No, the government never uses tax money
Yes, but only for hospitals, not schools

questions.explanation_correct: Arjun's father is right. Tax money is used by the government to build and run schools, hospitals, roads, and many other public services. Without taxes, the government would not have money to provide these services.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taxes are directly related to government services. The government does use tax money. It is used for both schools AND hospitals, not just one. Tax money funds all public services.

questions.question_text: In India, at what age can a person vote?
questions.explanation_correct: In India, every citizen who is 18 years or older has the right to vote. Voting is the way people choose their leaders in a democracy. It is an important right and responsibility.
questions.explanation_incorrect: People cannot vote at 10 or 15 years — they are too young. The voting age is not 25 but 18. Every Indian citizen aged 18 and above can vote in elections.

questions.question_text: What does 'democracy' mean?

options.text: A country ruled by a king alone
A country where people choose their leaders
A country where only rich people make decisions

questions.explanation_correct: Democracy means a system of government where the people choose their leaders through voting (elections). India is the world's largest democracy, with millions of people voting to choose their leaders.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A country ruled by a king alone is a monarchy. A country with no government is anarchy. Democracy is not about only rich people deciding. Democracy means government chosen by the people.

questions.question_text: True or False: India is the world's largest democracy.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. India is the world's largest democracy. With over 140 crore (1.4 billion) people, India has the most voters of any democratic country in the world.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is correct. India, with its enormous population, is indeed the largest democracy in the world, where people choose their leaders through elections.

questions.question_text: Meera is 17 years old. Can she vote in the upcoming election?

options.text: No, she needs to be 18 years old to vote

questions.explanation_correct: Meera cannot vote yet because she is only 17. The minimum voting age in India is 18 years. She will be able to vote once she turns 18. Both men and women have equal voting rights.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not everyone can vote — you must be at least 18. Parent's permission does not matter — age is the requirement. Both men and women can vote. Meera just needs to wait until she turns 18.

questions.question_text: The streetlights in Anita's city are not working. Which local body should fix this?
questions.explanation_correct: Streetlights in a city are the responsibility of the Municipality (or Municipal Corporation). They manage city services including streetlights, road repairs, water supply, and garbage collection.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The army defends the country. Schools educate children. The post office delivers letters. The Municipality is responsible for city services like streetlights.

questions.question_text: Rahul sees a person lying injured on the road after an accident. Which service should be called?
questions.explanation_correct: An ambulance (108) should be called because the person is injured and needs medical help. The ambulance will take the person to the hospital. You can also call 112 for any emergency.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Fire Brigade is for fire emergencies. The post office delivers mail. Schools are for education. An injured person needs an ambulance (108) to get to the hospital.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is managed by the local government?
questions.explanation_correct: Garbage collection and road cleaning are managed by the local government (Panchayat in villages, Municipality in cities). The army, railways, and space missions are managed by the central (national) government.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The army is controlled by the central government. Railways are managed by the central government (Indian Railways). Space missions are by ISRO (central government). Local government manages garbage collection, roads, water, etc.

questions.question_text: The head of a village Panchayat is called the __________.
questions.explanation_correct: The head of a village Panchayat is called the Sarpanch. 'Sar' means head and 'Panch' means five. The Sarpanch is elected by the villagers to lead the Panchayat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Mayor heads a municipality. The Governor heads a state. The Collector is a district officer. The Sarpanch is the head of the village Panchayat.

questions.question_text:
Match the emergency number with the correct service:
100 — ?
questions.explanation_correct: 100 is the emergency number for Police in India. 101 is for Fire Brigade, 108 is for Ambulance, and 181 is for Women's Helpline.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 100 is not for the Fire Brigade (101), Ambulance (108), or Women's Helpline (181). 100 is specifically the Police emergency number in India.

questions.question_text: Why is it important for people to pay taxes?

options.text: So the government can buy gifts for everyone
So the government can provide public services like roads, schools, and hospitals
Taxes are not important at all
So the government can keep all the money

questions.explanation_correct: Taxes are important because the government needs money to provide public services. Without taxes, there would be no public roads, government schools, hospitals, police, fire brigade, or other services that everyone uses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The government does not buy personal gifts or keep the money. Taxes are very important. They fund public services like roads, schools, hospitals, police, and fire brigade for everyone's benefit.

questions.question_text: In a democracy, who has the power to choose the government?
questions.explanation_correct: In a democracy, the people of the country have the power to choose their government through voting. Every citizen aged 18 and above can vote, regardless of being rich or poor, man or woman.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a democracy, power is not limited to the rich, the army, or a king. All eligible citizens (18 years and above) have the right to vote and choose their leaders.

questions.question_text: Which of these people is providing a public service?

options.text: A child playing in the park

questions.explanation_correct: A police officer directing traffic is providing a public service. Public services are provided by government workers for the benefit of all people. The police help keep roads safe for everyone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Playing, eating dinner, and reading are personal activities. A police officer directing traffic is doing a public service — helping everyone use the roads safely.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of the local government?
questions.explanation_correct: Defending the country's borders is the job of the national (central) government and the armed forces, not the local government. Local government handles local services like cleaning streets, water supply, and parks.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cleaning streets, providing clean water, and maintaining parks are all local government responsibilities. Defending the country's borders is done by the Indian Army and the central government.

questions.question_text: In India, people must be at least __________ years old to vote.
questions.explanation_correct: In India, the minimum voting age is 18 years. Anyone who is 18 or older and is an Indian citizen can register to vote and participate in elections.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The voting age in India is not 16, 21, or 25. It is 18 years. This was lowered from 21 to 18 in 1989 to give more young people the right to vote.

questions.question_text: A postman who delivers letters is an example of:

options.text: A public servant providing a public service

questions.explanation_correct: A postman is a government employee who delivers letters and parcels. This is a public service because the post office is run by the government for the benefit of all people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A postman is not a farmer, teacher, or shopkeeper. A postman is a public servant who works for the government postal service, delivering letters and parcels to people.

questions.question_text: Priya asks, 'Why do we have to pay money when we buy things at a shop? Some of that money goes to the government as tax.' What is this tax called?
questions.explanation_correct: The tax we pay when buying things is called GST (Goods and Services Tax). It is included in the price of most items we buy. This money goes to the government to fund public services.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Income tax is on earnings. Property tax is on property. Pocket money is not a tax. GST (Goods and Services Tax) is the tax charged when we buy goods and services.

questions.question_text: True or False: In a democracy, both men and women have equal right to vote.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. In India's democracy, every citizen aged 18 and above has the right to vote, whether they are a man or a woman. All votes are equal and every vote matters.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is correct. India's constitution gives equal voting rights to all citizens aged 18 and above, regardless of gender.

questions.question_text: Vikram lives in a big city. The garbage is not being collected from his area. Who is responsible for this?
questions.explanation_correct: In a city, the Municipality (or Municipal Corporation) is responsible for garbage collection. Vikram's family should complain to the Municipality about the garbage not being collected.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Panchayat is for villages, not cities. The Prime Minister and army do not handle garbage collection. In cities, the Municipality is responsible for garbage collection.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a public service?
questions.explanation_correct: A private toy shop is a business, not a public service. Public services are provided by the government for the benefit of all people. Police, fire brigade, and government hospitals are all public services.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Police, fire brigade, and government hospitals are all public services run by the government. A private toy shop is a business run by a private person, not a public service.

questions.question_text: Which of these is built using tax money collected by the government?
questions.explanation_correct: National highways are built and maintained using tax money collected by the government. Bedrooms and private cars are bought with personal money. Toy stores are private businesses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bedrooms, private cars, and toy stores are private things not built with tax money. National highways are public infrastructure built and maintained using tax money.

questions.question_text: In the school election, students are voting for their class monitor. This is similar to:

options.text: How adults vote to choose the government in a democracy

questions.explanation_correct: A school election for class monitor is like a small democracy. Students vote to choose who they want as monitor, just like adults vote in elections to choose the government that will lead the country.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A school election is not like going to a market, playing sports, or reading. It is like a real democracy where people vote to choose their leaders.

questions.question_text: Which of these services is the local government responsible for?

options.text: Providing clean drinking water to the area

questions.explanation_correct: The local government (Panchayat or Municipality) is responsible for providing clean drinking water to its area. Space missions, railways, and currency are all handled by the central government.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Space missions (ISRO), Indian Railways, and making currency (Reserve Bank of India) are all central government responsibilities. Clean drinking water supply is managed by the local government.

questions.question_text: True or False: Firefighters risk their lives to save people from fire.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Firefighters are very brave. They enter burning buildings, rescue trapped people, and put out dangerous fires. They risk their own safety to protect others.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is correct. Firefighters are indeed very brave people who put their lives at risk to save others from fire and other emergencies.

questions.question_text: Suresh sees a traffic policeman standing at a crossing, helping children cross the road safely. The policeman is:
questions.explanation_correct: The traffic policeman is performing an important public service by keeping the road safe and helping children cross. Traffic management is one of the key jobs of the police.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The policeman is not wasting time, playing, or just standing around. He is doing an important job — keeping the road safe and protecting children, which is a valuable public service.

questions.question_text: If people stop paying taxes, what would happen?

options.text: The government would not have money for roads, schools, and hospitals

questions.explanation_correct: If people stopped paying taxes, the government would run out of money. Roads would not be repaired, government schools and hospitals would close, and public services like police and fire brigade would stop working.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If taxes stopped, things would definitely change for the worse. People would not get more money, and fewer (not more) schools would be built. The government relies on taxes to fund all public services.

questions.question_text: The head of a city Municipality is called the __________.
questions.explanation_correct: The head of a city Municipality is called the Mayor. Just as the Sarpanch leads the village Panchayat, the Mayor leads the city Municipality or Municipal Corporation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Sarpanch heads a village Panchayat. The President heads the country. A Principal heads a school. The Mayor is the head of the city Municipality.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is TRUE about voting in India?

options.text: Every citizen aged 18 or above can vote
Children of any age can vote

questions.explanation_correct: In India, every citizen who is 18 years or older can vote, regardless of gender, wealth, or religion. This is called universal adult suffrage and is a key feature of Indian democracy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Voting is not limited to men or rich people. Children cannot vote until they are 18. The correct answer is that every Indian citizen aged 18 or above has the right to vote.

questions.question_text: Which service takes care of our health?
questions.explanation_correct: Hospitals and doctors take care of our health. Government hospitals provide healthcare services to all people. Doctors, nurses, and other health workers help treat sick people and keep us healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Police maintain law and order. Fire Brigade fights fires. The Post Office delivers mail. Hospitals and doctors are the public service that takes care of our health.

questions.question_text: Panchayat is to village as Municipality is to __________.
questions.explanation_correct: Just as a Panchayat is the local government in a village, a Municipality is the local government in a city or town. They both manage local services but at different levels.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A Municipality is not for the country (that is Parliament), state (that is the state government), or school (that has a principal). A Municipality is the local government for a city or town.

questions.question_text: True or False: Government schools for children are funded by tax money.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Government schools are funded by tax money. The government uses taxes collected from people to pay teachers, build school buildings, and provide books and mid-day meals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is correct. Government schools are indeed funded by tax money. This is one of the most important uses of taxes — providing education for children.

questions.question_text: Why is voting important in a democracy?

options.text: It is not important at all
It lets people choose who will lead and make decisions for them
It is just a holiday from work

questions.explanation_correct: Voting is important because it is the way people choose their leaders in a democracy. By voting, citizens have a say in who will govern them and make decisions that affect their lives.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Voting is very important — it is not unimportant, just a holiday, or about prizes. It is the fundamental way citizens participate in democracy and choose their leaders.

questions.question_text: Which of the following correctly matches the emergency service with its number?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct matching is: Police — 100, Fire — 101, Ambulance — 108. Remember: 100 for Police, 101 for Fire, 108 for Ambulance. You can also use 112 for any emergency.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only one option has the correct matching: Police — 100, Fire — 101, Ambulance — 108. This is important to remember for emergencies.
